column16: Salix hastata is a deciduous Shrub growing to 2 m (6ft) by 2 m (6ft).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 6 and is not frost tender.  It is in flower from April to May. The species is dioecious (individual flowers are either male or female, but only one sex is to be found on any one plant so both male and female plants must be grown if seed is required).  and is pollinated by Bees. The plant is not self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and can grow in heavy clay soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers  moist or  wet soil.
